data.title: APA Citations for TV Shows Examples
data.meta_description: APA citation tv show examples to help you format easily and correctly. Sections for citing single episode of tv series, whole tv series & online tv shows.
data.text:
Follow these APA citations for TV shows examples when creating your works cited page. Writers for television shows often use the medium to explore social issues, such as racism, prison reform, gender identity and other social justice issues. Many programs produced in the 1970s brought such issues to the public’s attention. Television shows such as All in the Family, Maude, and The Jeffersons used comedy to highlight societal issues. Today’s shows promote understanding of people with autism, depression and developmental disorders. Using these sources helps the reader better understand your thesis statement and research argument in your APA 7 paper.

Basic APA Citation Format

The basic format you should follow when citing a television show in APA style is as follows:

Producer, A.A. (Producer). (Year, Month Day). Title of broadcast [Television broadcast]. Studio or Distributor.

In-Text Citation Format

Cite the last name of the producer(s) and/or director(s), plus the year, in parentheses for an in-text citation.

(Last Name Producer & Last Name Director, 2000)

Basic Examples in APA Style

Review these examples for how your citations should look in APA style.

Example 1 – APA Citation for TV Show

Lucas, M., Dugan, D. & Mackenzie, M. (Producers) (2019, July 5). Alastair Campbell: Depression and me [Television broadcast]. Windfall Films.

Example 1 – APA In-Text Citation

(Lucas, Dugan & Mackenzie, 2019)

Example 2 – APA Citation for TV Show

Murray, D. (Producer), & Miller, J.J. (Director). (2019). I am Richard Pryor [Television broadcast]. Paramount Network.

Single Episode of a Television Series

To cite a single specific episode of a television series, follow this basic format:

Writer, W. W. (Writer), & Director, D. D. (Director). (Date of publication). Title of episode [Television series episode]. In P. Producer (Producer), Series title. Studio or distributor.

In-Text Citation Format

(Writer & Director, Date)

Example Citation for Single Episode

Brownell, J. (Writer), & Koch, C. (Director). (2019, October 15). Flip a coin [Television series episode]. In Fogelman, Dan. (Creator). This is Us. NBC Studios.

Example In-Text Citation

(Brownell & Koch, 2019)

Television Series Citation Format

The basic format for citing a television series as a whole is as follows:

Producer, A. A. (Producer). (Year). Title of series [Television series]. Studio or Distributor.

Example Citation for TV Series

Duclon, D. (Producer). (2002) The Jeffersons [Television series]. CBS.

Online Television Shows

The format for citing online television shows is similar, except you add the retrieval URL to the end as follows:

Producer, A.A., & Producer, A. A. (Producers). (Year-Year). Title of series [Television series]. http://www.xxxxxxxxx.com

Example 1 Citation for Online TV Show

Fogelman, Dan. (Creator). (2016-2019). This is us [Television series]. https://www.hulu.com/series/this-is-us-9dc170da-85db-475d-9df4-6572f15ffb00

Example 2 Citation for Online TV Show
